title: NYC To Consider Proposal To Take Down Monuments, Just Like Trump Warned
description:
New York’s City Council is advancing a plan that could kill off monuments honoring figures such as George Washington and Christopher Columbus.

The proposal before the Cultural Affairs Committee stipulates that public art that depicts someone who has a connection to slavery or “crimes against humanity” be taken down or have an “explanatory plaque” put up.

This would potentially include the removal of George Washington, Peter Stuyvesant and Christopher Columbus statues.

— (@)

title: Missouri High School Crowns Male Homecoming Queen... Again
description:
The patriarchy strikes again as men continue to take more things from women as a high school in Kansas City, Missouri crushes the lifelong dreams of girls who have always wanted to become homecoming queen.

Oak Park High School has given the award of homecoming queen to a male student in a dress. This is the second time the school has given the award to a boy at Oak Park High School after he beat four females.

“Thank you so much Oak Park. I am so overwhelmed with love and gratitude, and it is all your doing. I am forever thankful that you have chosen me to be your homecoming queen,” Tristan Young wrote on Instagram, according to

title: Massachusetts Governor Demands Ban On Buying Single-Use Plastic Bottles
description:
Rather than focus on the state's drug crisis, Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey has decided to really prioritize her time and fight the invisible enemy instead, as she has announced her latest battle in the left-wings war on plastic.

Healey announced at The Clinton Global Initiative on Monday that she will be banning state agencies from purchasing single-use plastic b

title: Elon Musk Files Lawsuit Against Biden Admin Over DOJ's Demand SpaceX Hire Illegals
description:
Elon Musk's SpaceX filed a lawsuit on Friday against the U.S. government, claiming that the Department of Justice (DOJ) case accusing the company of refusing to hire refugees and asylum seekers violates the U.S. Constitution.

The lawsuit says the administrative judges who typically hear cases concerning employee bias against immigrants are not appropriately appointed, and that keeping the case out of court denies SpaceX its constitutional right to a jury trial.

The administrative hearing officer is appointed by the Justice Department, and we are to believe that is an impartial j

title: High school students stage walkout over district's woke bathroom policy: "Girls were upset… we wanted to protect them"
description:
Hundreds of students from the Perkiomen Valley School District in Pennsylvania walked out of class on Friday. They were protesting the district's new bathroom rules that let boys use the girl's bathroom if those boys say they are girls. Presumably, girls saying they are boys would be allowed to use the boys' room. But much like when it comes to the lack of stories of girls dominating boys' sports, you don't hear about that all that much.

The young chad who organizated the walkout, John Ott, told Fox News: "Kids were upset. Girls… we wanted to protect them. They were upset. They didn't want men in their bathroom."

title: Watch: 1,000 "canine beings" gather in protest, howl at the moon to advocate for freaks who identify as dogs
description:
Earlier today, we offered you a little king hyping up his Pop Warner football team. It was a break from our usual fare of "everything sucks," "everything is terrible," and "dear God, someone do something." Regretfully, we are back to our regularly scheduled coverage of the wheels coming off the planet. A thousand puppy fetishists gathered in Germany to howl at the moon and demand you take them seriously.

Gathering at the Berlin Potsamer Platz railroad station in Germany, these *sigh* "canine beings" barked and howled each other while dressed as dogs. Ackshually, "Canine Beings" is the name of the advocacy group. I don't think they identify as "canine beings." You're free to identify them however you feel: "Freaks." "Lunatics." "

title: Watch: UAW union demands more pay, but Americans will be the ones who REALLY pay
description:
The auto workers' strike entered its fifth day amid a threat by the United Auto Workers (UAW) that the labor protest could soon escalate to more plants if no serious progress was made in talks with Ford, General Motors and Chrysler-parent Stellantis.

Today’s show dove right into the true cost of the strike, the American taxpayer.

The UAW walked off the job Friday after it failed to reach agreements on a new contract with the three major car makers, claiming they deserve a pay raise of 46% pay increase. Ford and GM are offering 20 percent, and Stellantis is offering 17.5 percent.

The

title: Watch this Little Dude Psyching Up His Team to DESTROY Their Opponents, It's All the Motivation You'll Ever Need
description:
A palate cleanser to offer a break between "everything sucks," "everything is terrible," and "dear God, someone do something." The news on any given day will beat you down. Don't say that to Little Dude in this video. Nothing is going to get him down.

He's ready to run out there and leave it all on the field. He's ready to eat lightning and crap thunder. Even though he's not old enough to say "crap." And his squad isn't going out there until they're as fired up as he is!

If this doesn't manage to both psyche you up AND warm your heart, you are dead inside and might want to have someone check that out.

— (@)

title: "Breaking Bad" actor ignored advice of his conservative doctor and is lucky to be alive: "The conservative was right"
description:
"Breaking Bad" star Bob Odenkirk shunned his "conservative" doctor's medical advice for political reasons. Now after being lucky to be alive after suffering a heart attack, he's beginning to think maaaaaybe he should have put politics aside and trusted his advice.

Odenkirk was seeing a doctor for twenty years, he told the “Don’t Ask Tig” podcast. Then tragedy struck. The actor learned his doctor had different political opinions than him. It was the signs up in the office that said they don't accept Obamacare. Not so much a political opinion as much as a "we need to pay employees and keep the electricity on" opini

title: Larry David gets in Elon Musk's face with hissy fit over GOP support: “Do you just want to murder kids?”
description:
Larry David got into Elon Musk's face at a wedding over Elon having different political opinions than him. Instead of curb-stomping Larry's enthusiasm, Musk answered with an emphatic "no" that contrary to Larry's hissy fit, Musk is very anti-kid murder.

It took place at super-agent Ari-Emmanuel's wedding last year, according to Walter Isaacson's new book Elon Musk. David performed the nuptials and found himself sitting at Elon's table. Like most progressive sh*tc*nts, the less funny co-creator of Seinfeld didn't like being near someone who had a different opinion than him.

title: Corporate sellout Howard Stern lashes out at Lauren Boebert showing too much t*tty. Yes, THAT Howard Stern!
description:
Howard Stern has become a colossal disappointment selling out to corporate media and the Democrat Party. But for those of us who came of age when he was the "King of All Media," this one hurts. Howard Stern attacking a woman as a disgrace for showing too much titty. Even if he is talking about Rep. Lauren Boebert.

Most of you know the story. Boebert and her date got way too amorous in public at a performance of BEETLEJUICE The Musical. The most offensive aspect being... they made a musical out of BEETLEJUICE? The Left got off on it, and if we're being honest? Game respect game. Had it been social media influencer Rep. AOC giving her date a handy while showing off an impressive amount of cleavage, we on the Right would have had a field day with it. Of course, that would require Rep. AOC and
